member.name: T:Windows.Storage.Streams.ByteBuffer
member.summary: Provides a byte array implementation of the IBuffer interface and its related interfaces.
member.remarks: This class is intended for internal use of nanoFramework classes. The developer shouldn't use it directly.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.Streams.ByteBuffer.#ctor(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Buffer class with the specified capacity.
member.param: The maximum number of bytes that the buffer can hold.

member.name: P:Windows.Storage.Streams.ByteBuffer.Capacity
member.summary: Gets the maximum number of bytes that the buffer can hold.
member.value: The maximum number of bytes that the buffer can hold.

member.name: P:Windows.Storage.Streams.ByteBuffer.Length
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of bytes currently in use in the buffer.
member.value: The number of bytes currently in use in the buffer, which is less than or equal to the capacity of the buffer.

member.name: P:Windows.Storage.Streams.ByteBuffer.Data
member.summary: Gets or sets the byte array backing this .
member.value: The byte array backing this .

member.name: T:Windows.Storage.Streams.ByteOrder
member.summary: Specifies the byte order of a stream.
member.remarks: nanoFramework API only supports LittleEndian order.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Streams.ByteOrder.LittleEndian
member.summary: The least significant byte (lowest address) is stored first.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.Streams.DataReader.#ctor(Windows.Storage.Streams.IInputStream)
member.summary: Creates and initializes a new instance of the data reader.

member.name: P:Windows.Storage.Streams.DataReader.ByteOrder
member.summary: Gets or sets the byte order of the data in the input stream.
member.value: One of the enumeration values.
member.remarks: nanoFramework doesn't this feature. ByteOrder is always .

member.name: P:Windows.Storage.Streams.DataReader.InputStreamOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the read options for the input stream.
member.value: One of the enumeration values.

member.name: P:Windows.Storage.Streams.DataReader.UnconsumedBufferLength
member.summary: Gets the size of the buffer that has not been read.
member.value: The size of the buffer that has not been read, in bytes.

member.name: P:Windows.Storage.Streams.DataReader.UnicodeEncoding
member.summary: Gets or sets the Unicode character encoding for the input stream.
member.value: One of the enumeration values.
member.remarks: nanoFramework doesn't this feature. UnicodeEncoding is always .

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.Streams.DataReader.DetachStream
member.summary: Detaches a stream that was previously attached to the reader.

member.param: The count of bytes to load into the intermediate buffer.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.Streams.DataReader.IncreaseReadPosition(System.Int32)
member.summary: Increases the backing buffer read position.
member.param: How many bytes to read from the backing buffer.
member.returns:
The current buffer position before increasing it by
count.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.Streams.DataReader.CheckReadPosition
member.summary: Checks current read position and resets the backing buffer if all bytes have been read

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.Streams.DataReader.CheckAvailableBytes(System.Int32)
member.summary: Throws an if caller tries to read more bytes than the ones that are available in backing buffer.
member.param: Number of bytes to be read

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.Streams.DataReader.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.name: T:Windows.Storage.Streams.DataWriter
member.summary: Writes data to an output stream.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.Streams.DataWriter.#ctor
member.summary: Creates and initializes a new instance of the data writer.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.Streams.DataWriter.#ctor(Windows.Storage.Streams.IOutputStream)
member.summary: Creates and initializes a new instance of the data writer to an output stream.

member.name: P:Windows.Storage.Streams.DataWriter.ByteOrder
member.summary: Gets or sets the byte order of the data in the output stream.
member.value: One of the enumeration values.
member.remarks: nanoFramework doesn't this feature. ByteOrder is always .

member.name: P:Windows.Storage.Streams.DataWriter.UnicodeEncoding
member.summary: Gets or sets the Unicode character encoding for the output stream.
member.value: One of the enumeration values.
member.remarks: nanoFramework doesn't this feature. UnicodeEncoding is always .

member.name: P:Windows.Storage.Streams.DataWriter.UnstoredBufferLength
member.summary: Gets the size of the buffer that has not been used.
member.value: The available buffer length, in bytes.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.Streams.DataWriter.DetachStream
member.summary: Detaches a stream that was previously attached to the writer.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.Streams.DataWriter.Flush
member.summary: Flushes data.
member.remarks: The Flush method ensures that the data has reached the target storage medium that the stream represents. For example, to improve application responsiveness and throughput, a file stream might respond to a write operation by copying the buffer into another temporary storage medium and returning immediately, while the target device begins writing the data concurrently. The Flush method doesn't complete until all data specified in previous write calls has reached the target storage medium. If the data can't be written, or an error occurred during a write operation, the method returns false. The Flush method may produce latencies and does not always guarantee durable and coherent storage of data.It's generally recommended to avoid this method if possible. This method is specific to nanoFramework. The equivalent method in the UWP API is: FlushAsync.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.Streams.DataWriter.MeasureString(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the size of a string.
member.returns: The size of the string, in bytes.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.Streams.DataWriter.Store
member.summary: Commits data in the buffer to a backing store.
member.remarks: This method is specific to nanoFramework. The equivalent method in the UWP API is: StoreAsync.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.Streams.DataWriter.WriteBoolean(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes a Boolean value to the output stream.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.Streams.DataWriter.WriteBuffer(Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer)
member.summary: Writes a number of bytes from a buffer to the output stream.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.Streams.DataWriter.WriteBuffer(Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer,System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Writes a range of bytes from a buffer to the output stream.
member.param: The starting byte to be written.
The number of bytes to write.

member.summary: Writes a byte value to the output stream.

member.summary: Writes an array of byte values to the output stream.

member.name: T:Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer
member.summary: Represents a referenced array of bytes used by byte stream read and write interfaces. Buffer is the class implementation of this interface.

member.summary: Gets the maximum number of bytes that the buffer can hold.
member.value: The maximum number of bytes that the buffer can hold.

member.summary: Gets the number of bytes currently in use in the buffer.
member.value: The number of bytes currently in use in the buffer which is less than or equal to the capacity of the buffer.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.Streams.IDataWriter.Flush
member.summary: Flushes data.
member.remarks: The Flush method ensures that the data has reached the target storage medium that the stream represents. For example, to improve application responsiveness and throughput, a file stream might respond to a write operation by copying the buffer into another temporary storage medium and returning immediately, while the target device begins writing the data concurrently. The Flush method doesn't complete until all data specified in previous write calls has reached the target storage medium. If the data can't be written, or an error occurred during a write operation, the method returns false. The Flush method may produce latencies and does not always guarantee durable and coherent storage of data.It's generally recommended to avoid this method if possible.

member.name: T:Windows.Storage.Streams.IInputStream
member.summary: Represents a sequential stream of bytes to be read.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.Streams.IInputStream.Read(Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer,System.UInt32,Windows.Storage.Streams.InputStreamOptions)
member.summary: Reads data from the stream.
member.param: A buffer that is used to return the array of bytes that are read. The return value contains the buffer that holds the results.
The number of bytes to read that is less than or equal to the Capacity value.
Specifies the type of the asynchronous read operation.
member.returns: The number of bytes that were actually read.
member.remarks: This method is specific to nanoFramework. The equivalent method in the UWP API is: ReadAsync(IBuffer buffer, UInt32 count, InputStreamOptions options).

member.name: T:Windows.Storage.Streams.InMemoryRandomAccessStream
member.summary: Provides random access of data in input and output streams that are stored in memory instead of on disk.

member.name: P:Windows.Storage.Streams.InMemoryRandomAccessStream.CanRead
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the stream can be read from.
member.value: True if the stream can be read from. Otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Windows.Storage.Streams.InMemoryRandomAccessStream.CanWrite
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the stream can be written to.
member.value: True if the stream can be written to. Otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Windows.Storage.Streams.InMemoryRandomAccessStream.Position
member.summary: Gets the byte offset of the stream.
member.value: The number of bytes from the start of the stream.
member.remarks: The initial offset of a IRandomAccessStream is 0. This offset is affected by both and operations.

member.name: P:Windows.Storage.Streams.InMemoryRandomAccessStream.Length
member.summary: Gets the number of bytes currently in use in the buffer.
member.value: he number of bytes currently in use in the buffer, which is less than or equal to the capacity of the buffer.

member.name: P:Windows.Storage.Streams.InMemoryRandomAccessStream.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the random access stream.
member.value: The size of the stream.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.Streams.InMemoryRandomAccessStream.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the InMemoryRandomAccessStream class.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.Streams.InMemoryRandomAccessStream.Read(Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer,System.UInt32,Windows.Storage.Streams.InputStreamOptions)
member.summary: Reads data from the stream.
member.param: A buffer that is used to return the array of bytes that are read. The return value contains the buffer that holds the results.
The number of bytes to read that is less than or equal to the Capacity value.
Specifies the type of the asynchronous read operation.
member.returns: The number of bytes that were actually read.
member.remarks: This method is specific to nanoFramework. The equivalent method in the UWP API is: ReadAsync(IBuffer buffer, UInt32 count, InputStreamOptions options).

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.Streams.InMemoryRandomAccessStream.Seek(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Sets the position of the stream to the specified value.
member.param: The new position of the stream.
member.remarks: Warning! This method does not check the position to make sure the value is valid for the stream. If the position is invalid for the stream, the ReadAsync and WriteAsync methods will return an error if you call them.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.Streams.InMemoryRandomAccessStream.Flush
member.summary: Flushes data in a sequential stream.
member.remarks: The Flush method may produce latencies and does not always guarantee durable and coherent storage of data. It's generally recommended to avoid this method if possible. This method is specific to nanoFramework. The equivalent method in the UWP API is: FlushAsync.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.Streams.InMemoryRandomAccessStream.Write(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Writes data in a sequential stream.
member.param: A buffer that contains the data to be written.
member.remarks: This method is specific to nanoFramework. The equivalent method in the UWP API is: WriteAsync.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.Streams.InMemoryRandomAccessStream.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.name: T:Windows.Storage.Streams.InputStreamOptions
member.summary: Specifies the read options for an input stream.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Streams.InputStreamOptions.None
member.summary: No options are specified.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Streams.InputStreamOptions.Partial
member.summary: The asynchronous read operation completes when one or more bytes is available.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Streams.InputStreamOptions.ReadAhead
member.summary: The asynchronous read operation may optionally read ahead and prefetch additional bytes.

member.name: T:Windows.Storage.Streams.IOutputStream
member.summary: Represents a sequential stream of bytes to be written.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.Streams.IOutputStream.Flush
member.summary: Flushes data in a sequential stream.
member.remarks: The Flush method may produce latencies and does not always guarantee durable and coherent storage of data. It's generally recommended to avoid this method if possible. This method is specific to nanoFramework. The equivalent method in the UWP API is: FlushAsync.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.Streams.IOutputStream.Write(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Writes data in a sequential stream.
member.param: A byte array buffer that contains the data to be written.
member.remarks: This method is specific to nanoFramework. The equivalent method in the UWP API is: WriteAsync(IBuffer buffer).

member.name: T:Windows.Storage.Streams.IRandomAccessStream
member.summary: Supports random access of data in input and output streams.

member.name: P:Windows.Storage.Streams.IRandomAccessStream.CanRead
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the stream can be read from.
member.value: True if the stream can be read from. Otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Windows.Storage.Streams.IRandomAccessStream.CanWrite
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the stream can be written to.
member.value: True if the stream can be written to. Otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Windows.Storage.Streams.IRandomAccessStream.Position
member.summary: Gets the byte offset of the stream.
member.value: The number of bytes from the start of the stream.
member.remarks: The initial offset of a IRandomAccessStream is 0. This offset is affected by both and operations.

member.name: P:Windows.Storage.Streams.IRandomAccessStream.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the random access stream.
member.value: The size of the stream.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.Streams.IRandomAccessStream.Seek(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Sets the position of the stream to the specified value.
member.param: The new position of the stream.
member.remarks: Warning! This method does not check the position to make sure the value is valid for the stream. If the position is invalid for the stream, the ReadAsync and WriteAsync methods will return an error if you call them.

member.name: T:Windows.Storage.Streams.UnicodeEncoding
member.summary: Specifies the type of character encoding for a stream.
member.remarks: nanoFramework API only supports UTF8 encoding.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Streams.UnicodeEncoding.Utf8
member.summary: The encoding is UTF-8.
